subject: Re: [junit] RE: [OT] NoClassdefFoundError
msgSnippet: ... Try this : public class NoClassTest extends TestCase { static class BadClass { static { if(1 != 2){ throw new RuntimeException( 1 is not equal to 2 ); } }
messageBody:
Ilja Preuss wrote:
> junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
>
>>ClassDefNotFoundError is thrown when a class could not be loaded
>>usually because its static initializer threw an exception.
>>
>
>>because noone ever
>>knows what it means (we get about 3 support calls about it a day)
>
>
> It obviously means that not class definition for the specified classname
> could be found. How could it get more specific?
>

Try this :


public class NoClassTest extends TestCase {

static class BadClass {
static {
if(1 != 2){
throw new RuntimeException("1 is not equal to 2");
}
}

public static int add(int x, int y){
return x + y;
}
}

public void testFirstTime() throws Exception {
assertEquals(5, BadClass.add(2, 3));
}

public void testSecondTime() throws Exception {
assertEquals(5, BadClass.add(2, 3));
}

}

testFirstTime() fails with java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
which is fairly specific and easy to debug.

testSecondTime() fails with java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError which is
misleading and noone ever understands it until they have had it
explained to them, usually after several hours of debugging.

As I said before, we get countless support calls where the customer says
"How come I am getting a NoClassDefFoundError? The class is there and
it's on my classpath."

Apparently a lot of people are under the misapprehension that
NoClassDefFoundError means that the class def was not found. That's not
what it means.

>
> Confused, Ilja
>

Kevin
